title.narrative: Cash for Health in Emergencies Response (Covid-19) - Kenya

description.narrative:
This intervention will use conditional and unrestricted cash transfers to encourage vulnerable pregnant, lactating and mothers or girls with children under five years to attend health services and hospital childbirth delivery as well as to address the economic impacts of COVID-19. The services will include antenatal and postnatal clinic, hospital delivery and immunization schedule for children under-five as summarized as indicators below. Â§Â Number of antenatal appts attended by pregnant mothers/adolescent girls
Â§Â Number of postnatal visits undertaken (within 30 days of delivery) Â§Â Number of hospital deliveries or deliveries attended by trained attendant
Â§Â Number of children under five immunized (following routine schedule) The cash transfers will be disbursed on a monthly basis through mobile money transfer mechanism upon confirmation, the beneficiary has gone to the health facility and taken the health service. Confirmation will be done through a review of facility records triangulated by comparison of the mother and child booklet. Community health workers will be engaged to conduct sensitizations and follow-up among the target population.
